website_summaries.verdict: If you're looking for a baby wash that's gentle enough to use on all skin types, including eczema-prone skin, this fragrance-free, all-natural baby wash is simply unbeatable. The best on the market right now.
pros: Made from certified organic plant-based ingredients
Soothing calendula and aloe vera nourish and moisturize
Recommended by dermatologists and allergists for sensitive skin
When used as a shampoo, this is one of the few natural options that's truly tear-free
Safe for those with nut allergies
cons: Doesn't foam quite as much as we’d like

customer_reviews.title: Dermatologist recommended

customer_reviews.title: I was struggling with other soap that claimed to be ...
customer_reviews.text: I was struggling with other soap that claimed to be fragrance-free, and for sensitive skin. Everything caused my baby to break out in a rash with red, raised bumps all over his body. This is the first soap that does what it claims to do. I pair this with raw, unrefined shea butter. Now that my baby doesn't have raised bumps anymore his skin finally feels baby soft, and looks bright & clear.

customer_reviews.title: changed my mind---products reformulated
customer_reviews.text: As some people know, these products have been deceptively reformulated. My baby doesn't have sensitive skin, but I want to keep her 'toxin load' to a minimum. Earth Mama Angel Baby makes good stuff you can replace this with. It's basically just castile soap. I now use Dr. Bronner's pure castile soap (the baby-mild kind). It's cheap, pure, and one bottle lasts FOREVER. Even though my baby's skin isn't sensitive, I can't knowingly go on using California Baby, due to their allegedly dishonest practices and un-pure ingredients. Castile soap might not work for all super-sensitive skins, but it's worth looking into. Another option is to make your own soaps, which is surprisingly easy and super cheap. Good luck guys!
